Key Match Events: India (357/8) defeated Sri Lanka (55) by a 302-run margin.
Sri Lanka was bowled out for 55 runs.
India's dominant performance included a significant victory margin.
Pre-Game Insights: India is flying high with an unblemished record, having secured six convincing victories.
Sri Lanka, initially considered a potential surprise package, had reached the final of the recent Asia Cup on their home turf.
Sri Lanka has been plagued by injuries with captain Dasun Shanaka, Lahiru Kumara, and Matheesha Pathirana all ruled out.
India is expected to maintain the same playing XI that secured a victory against England in Lucknow.
Hardik Pandya is still unavailable and expected to regain fitness for the upcoming match against South Africa in Kolkata on November 5.
India aims to have their out-of-form player, Shreyas Iyer, regain his batting form.
Sri Lanka's spin bowlers have performed the weakest among all the teams in the World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place on November 2, 2023, at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.
Sri Lanka's spin bowlers have managed to secure just five wickets with an average of 121.6 in the World Cup.
